title: Andreesep
author: Andreesep
content: Good morning, as the title says. I need to withdraw money from an account in Russia and due to blocking issues it is impossible.The only solution in my mind is through Bitcoin, but I don't know about exchange houses in Russia that are reliable.Does anyone have any idea of ​​a reliable exchange in Russia? I'm from Mexico.Thanks for reading this.

comments.author: Helena Yu
comments.body: Can you elaborate? I don't understand what do you mean "an account in Russia", is that banks account? centralized exchange? or what?Since Russia currently get sanction from SEC, better to use no KYC P2P or decentralized exchange, you can use Bisq or Robosats, for the alternative check kycnot.me

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: There is a Russian section in this forum with Russians in it. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=10.0You should ask them what exchanges they use and in case by account you mean a bank account you should ask them which one accepts deposits from that bank.Try creating a topic there.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: Andreesep on September 13, 2024, 01:16:32 PMGood morning, as the title says. I need to withdraw money from an account in Russia and due to blocking issues it is impossible.What account is it?Bank account I guess. If bank does not allow you to withdraw money, how is it possible to use your account for purchasing Bitcoin?Type Russia in country column https://blockspot.io/exchange/I don't know about other exchanges but Livecoin is scam so as Yobit, somewhat scam and no customer support.Try to find it on https://www.bestchange.com/. It is a Russian company.It is better to ask locals like pooya87 said.

comments.author: Andreesep
comments.body: Hi, its a bank account. Thanks for the help. Ill post on the russian section.

comments.author: COBRAS
comments.created_time: September 13, 2024, 04:35:41 PMLast edit: September 14, 2024, 03:42:29 PM by hilariousandco
comments.body: Quote from: Andreesep on September 13, 2024, 01:16:32 PMGood morning, as the title says. I need to withdraw money from an account in Russia and due to blocking issues it is impossible.The only solution in my mind is through Bitcoin, but I don't know about exchange houses in Russia that are reliable.Does anyone have any idea of ​​a reliable exchange in Russia? I'm from Mexico.Thanks for reading this. Yes, you can easy buy usdt for rubles and after exchange usdt to any currency Sanction not tach usdt and other cryptocurrency. If you have a lot of money and you can trasfer cash to Moscow, I can provide to you supervreputable exchange point. Other way, find exchange at bastexchange.https://www.bestchange.com/cash-ruble-to-tether.htmlQuote from: Andreesep on September 13, 2024, 03:50:06 PMHi, its a bank account. Thanks for the help. Ill post on the russian section. Yee, in Rus section can help you, but be careful about scam ! Dont thrust any p2p deals without centralized exchange like localbitcoins !

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I’ve heard the best way to overcome this issue is to email people and tell them that you are a prince and need help getting your funds out of your country. People will surely jump at the opportunity to help you transfer money somehow after reading that. How could they not? Good luck. I hope it works out for you.

comments.author: COBRAS
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on September 14, 2024, 04:22:52 AMI’ve heard the best way to overcome this issue is to email people and tell them that you are a prince and need help getting your funds out of your country. People will surely jump at the opportunity to help you transfer money somehow after reading that. How could they not? Good luck. I hope it works out for you. Scammer from all internet start send him invites to them scam.

comments.author: davis196
comments.body: Quote from: Andreesep on September 13, 2024, 01:16:32 PMGood morning, as the title says. I need to withdraw money from an account in Russia and due to blocking issues it is impossible.The only solution in my mind is through Bitcoin, but I don't know about exchange houses in Russia that are reliable.Does anyone have any idea of ​​a reliable exchange in Russia? I'm from Mexico.Thanks for reading this. You mean bank account? If the bank account is blocked, how can you withdraw the money? Maybe you should try to unblock it first.Also, if the bank account is blocked, how can you use the fiat balance in it to for trading purposes? You should provide more details about your issue.As far as exchanging crypto to fiat(and vice versa), you should check out Bestchange. It's a Russian platform that lists multiple crypto-to-fiat and fiat-to-crypto exchangers. Beware of scammers, every crypto exchange platform has them. There's a review system in Bestchange, so maybe you should go with the exchangers that have the most positive reviews.

comments.author: pinggoki
comments.body: Wouldn't you risk getting flagged when there's still a sanction in Russia right now? And at the same time, you also risk the people that will help you in your problem because most likely, the money will be coming at their way since there's no other way right? It's a difficult situation that you're in and I think that you're going to need to clarify what's really happening to you OP if you want people to help you.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Actually, I have been quite in a comparable situation in which I had to help a friend to get money to Russia from the United States, to pay for the services of a digital artist. There is a popular Fiat digital wallet in Russia (I forgot it's name) which almost everyone uses. All you need to do is to find a non-KYC exchange in a directory like Bestchange and then create an order.You send the money to the Bestchange account in Russia and they will swap or for Bitcoin or other supported cryptocurrencies, which will be easily moved to anyone in the world. I won't name the specific service which was used by my friend to pay for services of the Russian artist, though, I would rather you do your own research and find the platform which suits you the best. Good luck and be aware of scammers, they are everywhere.

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: I am not qualified enough to help you out in this situation but I just wanted to know why a person from Mexico wants to withdraw money out of Russia? That's the first time for me and very weird. One suggestion for you is to stay away from scammers or phishing links if someone send you in DM on this forum. There is a local board for Russia If I am not wrong, try asking this question in there. You might get a faster solution.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: ImThour on September 15, 2024, 02:07:25 PMI am not qualified enough to help you out in this situation but I just wanted to know why a person from Mexico wants to withdraw money out of Russia? That's the first time for me and very weird. One suggestion for you is to stay away from scammers or phishing links if someone send you in DM on this forum.OP can receive phishing links in DM and you're right by warning OP about this risk.In return, I want to warn other people that they have to be careful if OP contacts them in DM and with whatever links or files.This can be a scam effort from people who play as a victim and naive forum members who want to help but are not experienced enough, will be scammed. This risk is true and already happened many times.OP, don't feel bad, I am not implying that you are a scammer, it's general warning.QuoteThere is a local board for Russia If I am not wrong, try asking this question in there. You might get a faster solution.Herehttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=10.0

comments.author: Cryptohygenic
comments.body: Quote from: Andreesep on September 13, 2024, 01:16:32 PMGood morning, as the title says. I need to withdraw money from an account in Russia and due to blocking issues it is impossible.The only solution in my mind is through Bitcoin, but I don't know about exchange houses in Russia that are reliable.Does anyone have any idea of ​​a reliable exchange in Russia? I'm from Mexico.Thanks for reading this. I think you will get better response here if only you can be transparent and emphasize more.When you say "block" I guess you mean "restrictions" that means the transaction you want to process is not permitted due to regulatory order.Is the fund in the fiats or bitcoin? What is the feasibility that bitcoin is the only option to make this withdrawal?

comments.author: coolcoinz
comments.body: Quote from: tranthidung on September 13, 2024, 02:23:52 PMBank account I guess. If bank does not allow you to withdraw money, how is it possible to use your account for purchasing Bitcoin?The answer is pretty simple.OP can't move money to another bank located outside Russia due to sanctions, but could use banks and services within Russia. This means that if he wanted to use that bank account to pay someone in Russia, he can, same with buying stuff in Russian stores. He could use a local bitcoin exchange, also physical since they also have those and then transfer bitcoin to any wallet, located in Mexico, or anywhere else.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: pooya87 on September 13, 2024, 02:22:24 PMThere is a Russian section in this forum with Russians in it. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=10.0You should ask them what exchanges they use and in case by account you mean a bank account you should ask them which one accepts deposits from that bank.Try creating a topic there.Good suggestions to follow by the ops because from the Russian local board he be able to get the help he need, although judging from his statement, he may have a hard time doing transaction from his bank since he mentioned restrictions and also being based in Mexico so alot of at stake as to getting the money out of Russia, you know how hard it is to send money from international locations unless if he has someone in Russian that have access to the bank account then be able to exchange the money on any exchange in Russia to bitcoin an then sending the funds to any locations he wish.

comments.author: CoinFoxs
comments.body: You can easily get that amount by buying bitcoin from binance, make account on binance go to p2p section and then see the orders and place your order their and buy bitcoins from your fiat currency. If binance is ban in your country then use vpn and complete trade. Better to ask this question in Russian section people from Russia will guide you better in this matter.

comments.author: COBRAS
comments.body: Quote from: CoinFoxs on September 15, 2024, 09:45:20 PMYou can easily get that amount by buying bitcoin from binance, make account on binance go to p2p section and then see the orders and place your order their and buy bitcoins from your fiat currency. If binance is ban in your country then use vpn and complete trade. Better to ask this question in Russian section people from Russia will guide you better in this matter.Binan e not work with Russia any rubles
